Here is some basic information on risk analysis: when we consider risk we make a decision on hazard x probability and then stratify the risk profile. For example hazard = COVID-19 infection and probability of infection in a shop= 0.5 ( a high estimate) then the risk is high. We then determine our risk mitigation strategies. 0% risk = not going to the shops. 100% risk = unprotected social contact with a Covid-19 infected person.Therefore Mitigation of intermediate risk = mask wearing, social distancing etc etc. Simples.
